ofx:section.ofx:title: Data Structure
ofx:section.ofx:paragraph: The data structure to of the core elements to manage maps and layers is shown in Figure .

media:image.ofx:title: Data Structure for Managing Maps and Layers

ofx:section.ofx:paragraph: There are four entities used for the data structure. The Category is only used to categorize different layer into thematic areas.

l:item.name: Service
l:item.ofx:paragraph: A Service characterizes a Web Mapping Service (WMS) or Web Feature Service (WFS) service by itâ€™s URL. Each service can contain multiple layers.

l:item.name: Layer
l:item.ofx:paragraph: Each service can provide different unique Layers identified by their code and and optional information if this layer has temporal values stored (WMS-T). A layer is published by WMS/WFS from a vector or raster data source with optional temporal information (WMS-T). Each layer is characterized by the specific code and contains individual information like cities, rivers or a terrain model.

l:item.name: Map
l:item.ofx:paragraph: A thematic map is is a composition of several layers in a defined order. Each map has information on the default viewport including the center position and the default zoom level.

l:item.name: View
l:item.ofx:paragraph: The View is the binding between the Map and the Layer this entity stores additional default properties like the order number, the default visibility or default legend information.
